choices: Boston, Anarkasia -  Interrogate Anarkasian official about rebellion
Martian Eco-Base 'Libra' - Investigate disappearance of TK Operative
Belfast, Northern Ireland - Prevent viral outbreak
Pangea (Triassic period) - Erase all human activity
1.content:
Commander Wilson stiffened as the new recruits ('new' being a relative statement) began leaking into the room. He stood in front of them all at a podium, like a college professor lecturing to a class. And the lesson for today was...

"Time-travel," he said, "is a very difficult thing to comprehend. As is time itself. It's understandable that you will have a lot of questions, but believe me, somebody could spend an eternity asking those questions and never find a satisfying answer. But you are no philosophers. It's not your jobs to answer those questions. You are... social workers. You correct time, guide it, not understand it."

Wilson glanced around the large room. I'm rambling again... Oh, way to make a first impression, Wilson

"You are all here, because according to the future field reports, you are the best and the brightest of all our new recruits, and of humanity. But remember, the future is always changing; just because we say you survive to see tomorrow, doesn't mean you will an hour later. Your actions have consequences that you cannot begin to comprehend - what you do effects your future, which effects your missions, which effects us. Follow protocol at all times, or you will be more trouble to us than you are worth."

Commander Wilson realised he was assuming a grave tone. He tried to lighten the mood.

"So, all you people who ever wanted to meet Elvis - you've got your chance right here."

He cringed as soon as he'd said. Humour... not one of my strong points.


"Now," he continued quickly, before the cadets had a chance to snicker at him. "You will be divided into five squads. Each squad will be assigned to a different mission. These are training missions - they are important, but will most likely not involve any combat situations. At least... so long as everything goes as planned..." a grim expression spread over Wilson's face "... but remember - this is a field operation, not a simulation. The dangers are very real. If you screw up, there can and will be catastrophic effects. Please follow the directions of your squad leader at all times. It is now time to make your choice..."

Wilson flicked a switch, and a number of choices flashed up on each cadet's metal wristband - their link to the Keeper mainframe.

"You see before you a list of five missions, each one identified by the destination and main objective. In descending order, they are assigned to the respective squads: Alpha, Beta, Gamma, Delta and Epsil. Make your choice by simply tapping the screen. You will be Phaseshifted shortly."
1.title: Mission Control

11.content:
Blake glanced around the moonlit streets of Cairo as his cadets materialised in a nearby alley. He approached them with a roguish grin.

"Alright guys, welcome to Alpha Squad. I'm Blake Remora, and I'll be your tour guide for the evening. Looks like we're on the prowl for some misplaced technology today. Don't fret - just keep your wits about you, don't do anything stupid, and before you know it, your first mission will be behind you..."

Blake flashed another sparkling white grin.

"Now I'd like to run through your equipment. First up is what I like to call the 'Keeper-Beeper'." He tapped the metal wristband on his arm. "It's basically your best friend - other than me, of course. It allows you to communicate with the other members of your squad - as well as Alpha Controller, back at HQ - and receive mission updates if or when they arise. It also has a rudimentary map of the area built-in, complete with flashing dots showing your squad mates' positions. Handy stuff."

"This..." Blake pulled a gun out of his holster and held it for the group to see. "Is a Phase pistol. It's not like conventional weaponry - it's more of a hand-held time machine: whatever you hit is sent to Keeper HQ to be evaluated, and 'erased'. Essentially, it gets rid of bad things that shouldn't be around. Like these schematics!"

"Lastly..." he holstered his phase pistol and struck a pose, showing off the silvery, skin-tight suit. "Is our uniforms. They're called Chameleon Suits, and they're pretty damn impressive - we seem them as they are, but while active they actually project a holographic image of regular clothes worn in this particular dimension. In effect, they allow us to blend in. You can also activate an optic camouflage mode with that little blue button on your wristband, which bends the light around you and makes you all invisible. But it drains the battery fast, so try not to use it too much..."

Blake glanced around. "Any questions?"
11.title: Drop Zone Alpha

12.content:
Jack observed his surroundings. A warehouse - big, empty, about three stories high. His squad phase-shifted into the space around him, one by one. He waited until they were all there before addressing them gruffly.

"You're in my squad, cadets. Beta Squad. I'm Jack Vyper, your leader for this mission. It seems we're looking to interrogate the vice president of Anarkasia - find out how he overthrew the American government so easily. If you want to survive this, you all better listen to me."

Jack took a cigarette from a pack in his boot and lit it up, trying not to think how much shit he'd be in if the higher-ups knew he'd managed to smuggle cigs through the Shifter.

"I'm sure you all know what that metal thing attached to your arms are. It's what we use to communicate with each other. It's also got a map, in case one of you stupider cadets get lost. Once in a while Beta Controller will send you mission updates, so pay some bloody attention if it starts to blink."

"Now..." Jack pulled a gun out of his holster and fired at the ground. A chunk of the floor instantly vaporised. "This is a phase pistol. It's not like conventional weaponry, rather it phase-shifts things back to HQ so they can make sure you didn't fuck up. They evaluate it, then erase it if they see fit. Just make sure to aim at the bad guys."

"Then we have the Chameleon Suits, which projects a holographic image of regular clothes worn in this particular dimension onto your body. You can also activate an optic camouflage mode with that little blue button on your wristband, which bends the light around you, blurring you out. Good for when you've got nowhere to hide, but it runs out of juice fast. Try not to use it."

Jack glared. "Any questions? If not, then go off and complete this bloody mission so I can go home..."
12.title: Drop Zone Beta

choices: join in and have some fun.
go and speak to the girl.
121.content:
"uh yeah i've got a question sarge!" you piped up making the room drop silent. jack stopped what he was doing only to stop and glare at you, nodding slightly as he did so. "these suits of ours, can they do other things?" you asked. Jack pulled a long face before looking down at the device on his wrist and pressing in a button, letting out a blinding beam of light. as you lowered your hands down from your face you noticed a tall long blonde haired cowgirl stood before you where jack had once stood. a cowboy hat sat upon the top of her head, her long blonde hair came over the front of her shoulders. the cowgirl only wore a small crop top that barley covered her breasts along with a pair of leather pants, and of course she had cowgirl boots, spurs and all.

"Is this what you was wondering?" she asked you raising her hands upwards. you quickly noticed the cigarette lit in her mouth, wait a second, that's jack? "sarge?" you asked. "yeah what is it?" the cowgirls snapped back at you in an enraged tone. yup it was jack alright. "Hard light holographic projection, or at least that's what the boys back in the labs are calling it. it allows you to physically become anyone of your choosing, combine that with your nano machines and you can even make yourself believe that you are that person do i make myself clear?" Jack yelled at you> "sir, yes sir" you yelled back at him or well now her. "now then, seeing as the rookie here has gone and gotten me all dolled up for the occasion all of you will too be joining me like this, am i clear?" jack yelled at you and your squad. "sir, yes sir" you and the squad replied in union.

you all reached towards the devices on your wrists and hit the button. you concentrated deeply on who to disguise yourself as, thinking back too the times before you signed up. you remembered that one girl you made out with years ago at a rave your friend had dragged you too. when you re-opened your eyes you realised that the suit had worked. you hair was now a compilation of different colours crashing together, as was your top and jeans. your wrists were covered in different neon wristbands, and you where now weaing the googles that she had had on top off her head.

"well gollie rookie, ain't you a pretty fucking princess" Jack yelled out loud directing that comment towards you. Jack approached you still in disguise as the cowgirl, the thought of this woman as jack amused you slightly. "tell you what son you ain't half bad, but i don't see any goddamn jewellery do you!?" he yelled in his new feminine voice, amusing you slightly. you once again used the suit to attach a pair of neon lit earnings on yourself, the dark hangar making them glow a bright blue colour. "now ain't that something" Jack said impressed by how quickly you managed such a feat "but mine are still better, son" he boasted at you as he moved his long flowing hair revealing a pair of revolver shaped earnings he to had dressed himself with.

Jack walked away as you turned your attention around the room, you noticed how the men of the squad had begun feeling up each others new feminine body's with one another. even a few of themn where getting a little carried away, Jack didn't step in, he just stood there admiring the view. you continued to look around the room noticing the one female member of the squad from earlier, she too had shifted but found the sight of all these girls suddenly coming on to each other a little odd.
121.title: Stay and ask a question.

13.content:
Diana glanced confusedly around the hydroponic farm. It looked like a giant greenhouse, complete with giant green plants. She suddenly felt small. But there was no time for idle thought - the recruits were here!

"Huh, welcome to Gamma Squad, ladies and gentlemen. I'm Diana Paene, Squad Leader. Listen, we're on a rather serious mission - a friend of mine, Blake Remora, has gotten himself into a spot of trouble. We're not sure what, exactly, but it's possible he's been incapacitated... or worse. Just, try not to do anything stupid, 'kay?"

Diana tried to smile, but it struck even her as a sad attempt.

"Now I'd like to run through our equipment. First we have our comm devices, mounted on our forearms." She tapped the metal wristband on her arm. "It basically allows you to communicate with the other members of your squad - as well as Gamma Controller back at HQ - and receive mission updates if or when they arise. It also has a rudimentary map of the area built-in, complete with flashing dots showing your squad mates' positions. It's probably your most important piece of equipment - treat it well, folks."

"This..." Diana pulled a gun out of her holster and held it for the group to see. "Is a phase pistol. It's not like conventional weaponry - it's more of a hand-held time machine: whatever you hit is sent to Keeper HQ to be evaluated, and 'erased'. Just point and shoot - simple as that. It's non-lethal, yet gets the job done, and allows us to keep track of your targets."

"Lastly..." she holstered her phase pistol and gestured at the silvery, skin-tight suits. "Is our uniforms. They're called Chameleon Suits - we see them as they are, but while active they actually project a holographic image of regular clothes worn in this particular dimension. In effect, they allow us to blend in. You can also activate an optic camouflage mode with that little blue button on your wristband, which bends the light around you and makes you invisible to the naked eye. But it drains the battery fast, so try not to use it too much, okie dokie?"

Diana glanced around, determination in her eyes. "Now, let's split up and find Blake."
13.title: Drop Zone Gamma

choices: your first jump is somewhere in the 21st century.
Actually lets meet your squad before hand. (Or something else.)
131.content:
As Diana finished her speech you raised your hand in the air. "Pardon me miss but do the suits have any other functions?" She seemed to give a annoy sigh at this but turned to the other operatives in the room.

"Men move out except you operative you'll be leaving last understood." Everyone included you shouted out a.
"Yes ma'am yes." She nodded before yelling out

"dismissed!" the other operatives leave the room in a single filed line leaving you alone with Miss Diana. "Do I look like your grade school teacher private." you shake your head no before but she seems to growl at you before you say. "No Ma'am." you say nervously she pulls back as you cower. "Maybe you aren't ready for this operation yet.Maybe I should send you back to basic training then." You shake your head rapidly. "Then stay quiet. now go get the information on the file on your target. understood?" You nod your head as you leave to head to a computer room of the Time keepers HQ. as you return to the room file in hand the door sides open as replacing the commander was a women in a bathing suit she had long shining hair that reached down to her rear, the suit showed off a healthy amount of cleavage. her body was beautiful you slink over to her eyes focused on her body.

"Why hello sugar what you got there?" You get distracted as she walks over to you and tries to take the file.
"Sorry miss but this is very special information" you say trying to stay focused but the strange women starts to walk up to you getting right in your face.
"Oh come on sweetie there's nothing wrong with a little peek hm maybe I can give you something in return." Says the strange women as she grabs your hand and moves it to her chest. you try to pull back but he surprisingly strong. as your hand makes contact though you kind of just blank for a sec not even noticing you dropped the file.

The women smiles again but only for a second as your world spins around you one second you where standing tall the next your face is smashed against the cold steel floor and your arms was twisted behind your back and you hear zip-ties(?). where was she hiding those? you only think this for a moment when a Chameleon Suits boot placed in front of you. slowly the women shifts back into Commander Paene. "Nice job trying to resist solder but you've should have tried to detain me not talk to me." She says picking you up and cutting the ties. "Now you see the other use of the Chameleon suit temporary disguises the subject will see you as who ever you decided to hide as." She moves to the back wall a bit before hitting a button. "I hope this was a worth while training experience for all of you." she says hitting a button and on a holographic display shows your whole squad. you blush embarrassed as they probably saw everything. "Now to use the Disguise feature merely type in the parameters of the disguise into your communicator and find a quiet place to change got it?" she said you and your squad responded with a yes ma'am. "Good now get out there no one else is going to fix the time stream."

With that you and your squad leave many throwing a few jokes your way but beginning your mission to fix all of time.
131.title: A harsh leason on one piece of gear.

14.content:
Erin looked up and down the streets of Belfast. There was something sinister about this place. He turned and watched as his cadets fizzled into existence, addressing them when they had all arrived.

"Howaya lads, and welcome to Delta Squad. I'm Erin Murphy, and I'll be leadin' yas on this mission yoke, right? We've got a tough one - we're lookin' ta stop a virus from bein' released. Means we've gotta move quick - there's a time limit holdin' our bollocks like a vice-grip." He grinned. "Pardon me, ladies..."

Erin straightened up, running a hand through his hair.

"Guess I might as well run through yer equipment. First up is what we call tha 'Keeper-Beeper'." He tapped the metal wristband on his arm, smiling to himself. "It's pretty much yer best friend 'round here. It allows ya ta communicate with the odher members of yer squad - as well as Delta Controller, back at tha Head Quarts - and receive update yokes, y'know, if they pop up. It also's got a map of the area built-in, complete with flashing thingies showing your buddies' positions. Handy stuff, tha."

"Next..." Erin said gleefully, pulling a gun out of his holster. "Is a Phase pistol. Sweet piece a work this: whatever you hit is sent to 'Keepa HQ to be evaluated, and either chucked out, or put back in. In other words, zap the virus, when ya find it."

"Lastly..." he holstered his phase pistol and patted his silvery, skin-tight suit. "Is our uniforms. They're called Chameleon Suits, and they're the fucking deadliest thing I've ever seen - we see 'em as they are - silvery and form-fittin' - but while workin' they actually project a holographical image-deally of regular clothes worn in this particular time and place. Dey allow us ta blend in. You can also hit tha little blue button on yer wristband, and ye'll turn invisible. But it drains the battery fast, so try not ta use it all that much..."

Erin glanced around. "Any questions? Don't be afraid ta speak up. I won't bitecha. Unless it's a really stupid question..."
14.title: Drop Zone Delta

15.content:
EMMA stood still, surveying her surroundings. The land was barren, with large reptilian beasts roaming around. They appeared aggressive. There was also a forest of trees nearby. Among all this, it was easy to spot the large, steel complex a few miles into the forest, looming above.
As EMMA heard the crackle of phase-shifting, she turned to face the humans of her squad.

"Greetings. I am E.M.M.A., leader of Epsil Squad. Our assignment is to eradicate the temporal terrorists that have taken refuge within this time. Our objective is to plant a phase bomb within their facility, erasing its presence here. To avoid a combat situation, please proceed with utmost caution and stealth."

EMMA's eyes scanned the group, digitally recording faces and evaluating her cadets based on posture, facial expression, body language, and other variables.

"Your equipment is as follows: The ChronoComm Device, found attached to your forearms. It allows you to communicate with the other members of your squad - as well as Epsil Controller, who is monitoring our progress at Headquarters - and receive mission updates if, or when they arise. There is also a rudimentary map of the area built-in, complete with beacons displaying other operative's positions."

"The Phase pistol. Unlike conventional weaponry, whatever you hit is sent to Keeper HQ to be evaluated, and, if deemed necessary, disposed of. It is to be used only in matters of self defense, and within mission parameters."

"Finally, Chameleon Suits. They project upon you a holographic image of regular clothes worn in this particular dimension. You may also activate an optic camouflage feature, using your ChronoComm Device, which bends the light around you, rendering you difficult to visualise without digital aid. Please use this function sparingly - the battery life is minimal."

EMMA glanced around. "Are there any questions?"
15.title: Drop Zone Epsil

choices: EMMA asks you to touch her.
151.content:
"uh yeah i have a few questions, if that's oik with you? EM...?" you asked hesitantly. "my correct designation is 3.M.M.A, but you may pronounce that as EMMA. What question would you like to ask?" she responds immediately in a emotionless tone. your squad continues to march towards their objective as you quickly dash towards EMMA walking closely next to her. "these suits of ours, do they have any other function except, ya know, invisibility and stuff?" you asked unsure of how to word your question. EMMA ponders for a second before Turning towards you. "Your chameleon suit comes pre-equipped with a set of basic functions that align with your nano-machines, these functions include holographic cover, cloaking and holographic hard light projection." she listed at you, not even stopping for a breath, but then again why would she.

"wait, wait, wait. What was that last one?" you asked un-aware of such a function. "The mk4 chameleon suit comes pre-equipped with a hard light hologram projection unit. This unit allows one to project themselves as a full body person, from their sex orientation and physical form. This function also works in conjunction with your nano-machines allowing the user to alter their internals to match there current form and can even replicate personality traits and mannerisms." she let out, once again not stopping even for a second. "do you require a demonstration?" EMMA asks you much to your surprise. "yeah, i mean yeah sure!" you respond immediately. "SQUAD! HOLD POSITION!" EMMA yell aloud, the rest of your squad coming to a halt. EMMA turns back to you and gestures for you to enter the nearby cave.

you enter the cave with EMMA closely behind you. now with only the two off you alone in the cave, EMMA raises her hands upwards and begins the projection process. with a blinding beam of light scanning EMMA up and down you quickly avert your eyes, as you re-open your eyes you cannot believe the sight in front of you. Before you stood a tall and elegant lime green haired beauty of a young woman, her huge spectacles that now adorned her face refracted the glimmers of light that entered the cave. EMMA's new form was wrapped tightly by a white and green dress that flew elegantly to the floor, and her arms where covered by a matching set of gloves. "Princess ardonia, born roughly 23 years ago, soon to be heir to the throne of the new EUE, current whereabouts unknown." the new women declared in front of you. it wasn't her voice, but by the monotone nature of how she spoke you realised that it was still EMMA in front of you.
151.title: Stay, and ask a question.

choices: you continue to take it further.
you decided to test out this technology yourself.
1511.content:
"Please approach me and feel this new form" EMMA Orders politely. you oblige and slowly but surely walk towards her .when you finally approach her you reach out towards EMMA's new form hesitantly but before you can even lay a finger on her she reaches out and grabs hold of your hand placing it on her chest forcefully. you begin to feel embarrassed as this majestic green haired woman had just forcefully grabbed a hold of your hand and placed it around one of her breasts, all whilst not even display a tiny bit of emotion. "Feels like its real, doesn't it?" EMMA asks you, still in her monotone manner but with a now softer more feminine voice. you start to feel yourself getting carried away and bring your other hand up towards her other breast and begin to grope that one too. you begin to enjoy the sensation of this woman stood before you allowing you to fondle her in such a manner.

you hadn't realised it yet but EMMA began to notice your enjoyment of the situation. "now i shall demonstrate the personality hormone injectors" she said at you, shocking you a little. she hadn't told you to stop, so why stop. EMMA noticed your enjoyment and found a little fun in catching you off guard. before long EMMA closed her eyes and within a few seconds she re-opened them, looking down towards you as you continued to fondle her enlarged breasts. "oh darling why stop there? why not take your affection a little further and treat me like the princess i truly am?" EMMA said to you in a soft moan. this time the voice carried a soft sultry emotion with it, catching you off guard a little. unbeknown to you EMMA was loving this, she hadn't come pre-installed with emotions so she took every chance she got to replicate them.

you lowered your left hand down towards her soft ass and gripped into it firmly with EMMA letting out a little bite of her bottom lip. "Come now, show me how much you truly care." she said egging you on to go further.
1511.title: EMMA asks you to touch her.

info.brief_description: Nothing is more unpredictable than time. Nothing more dangerous than trying to control it.
info.description:
** Images For Use By Upgraded+ Only **




Somewhere along the course of time, someone invented what could only be described as a 'time machine', for want of a better word. The second this happened, time as we know it was shattered into a million pieces. No, an infinite number of pieces.

Time is normally linear - every split second, trillions of dimensions are destroyed, and the correct dimension is chosen as the next step within the timeline. The future is always uncertain - up to chance - but past and present are solid. Unchanging.

But with the dawn of time travel, all that has been disrupted. Time is immaterial. As is space. The laws of physics have been turned on its head. The universe has descended into chaos. The past is now as uncertain as the future - ever-changing. Time is no longer linear, but a web - every dimension linked to every other by a technology that shouldn't be.

There is but one answer to this problem: find the man who first invented time travel, and kill him before he can. Then make certain the technology will never again wreak havoc within the space-time continuum. This is the role of the Time Keepers. The last hope for order within the universe.




Feel free to do what you like with this, but remember: this is a serious story. You can add humour, or even come up with some outlandish situations, but please don't mess around. I reserve the right to delete any non-serious, or sub-standard chapters that I come across. And if you come across something that strikes you as not fitting in, feel free to send an e-mail to me (preferably before continuing the story, for continuity issues obviously...)
Also, the usual stuff like grammar, punctuation, spelling, ease of reading, structure, etc. shall be monitored. For your own good, of course ;-P
And naturally, you should stay within the 18+ content rating!

Beyond that, just remember to have fun...
